newsitem.title: USA: Acadia management takes control of company.
newsitem.headline: Acadia management takes control of company.

text.p: Acadia National Health Systems Inc said Thursday its management team, lead by chief executive Paul Chute and vice president Jacquelyn Magno, acquired a controlling and majority interest in the company.
The company was not immediately able to provide financial details on the deal.
Acadia said said Chute plans to continue with its plan of making acquisitions within the physician practice and management consulting industry.
The company said it has had acquisition talks with several doctor billing companies located on the east coast of the U.S., as well as two software organizations.
It also said it has met with several financial institutions to help with its acquisition plans.
